title: Why is Sinead leaving Corrie and what is Katie McGlynn doing next?
text:
Katie McGlynn has already filmed her final scenes (Picture: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

Sinead Tinker (Katie McGlynn) is leaving Coronation Street under very tragic circumstances in swiftly coming scenes.

New wife and young mum Sinead will be leaving the Cobbles forever, leaving behind her broken husband Daniel (Rob Mallard).

Here’s what you need to know about why we won’t be seeing much more of the popular character…

Why is Sinead leaving Coronation Street?

Sinead will be leaving Corrie as she dies of cervical cancer.

First diagnosed in 2018, she initially seemed to respond to treatment, but she eventually opted for holistic treatment after she began to fear that chemotherapy would harm her then-unborn son Bertie.

Then, on her wedding day of all days, she learned that the cancer had spread to her liver and lymph nodes, and that she had mere months to live.

"The first time I set eyes on you it was like I was coming home"… 😢💔 Our hearts are breaking for Sinead and Daniel.#Corrie Visit: https://t.co/P5cXcT73S3 if you have been affected by Sinead's story. pic.twitter.com/GKb6AhLrVk — Coronation Street (@itvcorrie) October 24, 2019

On the subject of her Corrie character’s demise, Katie has said: ‘I kind of underestimated the effects that it’s had on my mental health. I sound silly saying it but I believe Sinead is real. I played her for six-and-a-half years. Me and Corrie created this character and I feel like she’s my friend.’

She continued: ‘Watching her die was just awful, but it’s raising awareness and I just hope that we are doing that.

‘I love this storyline because it covers so many issues. I just wanted to highlight the fact people are dying of cancer.’

When discussing her choice to leave the soap, actor Katie previously said on social media: ‘I wasn’t AXED, it was my decision to leave to pursue other opportunities…this outcome was the only way Sinead would ever leave her family & @itvcorrie behind. It was a mutual decision.’

In September, Katie confirmed that her first acting role post-Corrie would be as Tinker Bell in panto Peter Pan at the Northwich Memorial Court in Cheshire.

In response to a tweet from AB Productions, the 26-year-old wrote: ‘Sooo excited to be Tink’.

This production will run from 8 December 2019 until 3 January 2020.

Sooo excited to be Tink 🧚🏻‍♀️💚 https://t.co/M1VzW8nFiL — Katie McGlynn (@KatiexMcGlynn) September 27, 2019

Coronation Street airs a special hour-long episode tonight at 7:30pm.
